titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the White Pine Mill Ledger
1904-1907
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by MarcEdit

publicationstmt.publisher: Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana--Missoula

profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard)

repository.corpname: University of Montana, Mansfield Library, Archives and Special Collections

did.abstract: A ledger from the White Pine Mill in White Pine, Montana, for 1904-1907. The ledger includes accounts receivable for lumber sales, accounts payable for logging-related expenses, and a section by section record of logging done.

bioghist.p: The White Pine Mill, owned by Patrick Whalen, was located in or near the small town of White Pine, Montana, which was about 115 miles northwest of Missoula Montana. The mill sold lumber within the state and to businesses in Idaho, North Dakota, and Minnesota. The proximity of the Northern Pacific Railroad and the Clark Fork River made such far-ranging sales possible. While the mill seemed to thrive between 1904 and 1907, it no longer existed under that name by 1910. By 1913 Patrick Whalen listed his occupation as well driller and his wife, Anna C. Whalen, owned the general store and was the White Pine postmaster.

scopecontent.p: A ledger from the White Pine Mill in White Pine, Montana, for 1904-1907. The ledger includes accounts receivable for lumber sales, accounts payable for logging-related expenses, and a section by section record of logging done.

accessrestrict.p: Researchers must use collection in accordance with the policies of Archives and Special Collections, the Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, and The University of Montana--Missoula.
